headline: Citi to turn to more minority investors after Banamex stake sale
summary: Citigroup will look for more minority investors in its Mexican retail unit, Banamex, before launching a potential initial public offering, executives said on Thursday.  Citi will sound out top Mexican investors in the coming months, though it will look to sell stakes much smaller than the 25% that billionaire Fernando Chico Pardo will buy, Ernesto Torres, Citi's head of international, told journalists.  The lender announced on Wednesday that Chico Pardo, who chairs airport operator ASUR, would purchase the sizeable stake in Banamex for $2.3 billion.

headline: Citi and Dandelion Collaborate to Transform Cross-Border Payments, Enabling Full Value, Near-Instant Payments into Digital Wallets Across the Globe
summary: NEW YORK, September 25, 2025--Today, Citi and Dandelion, a Euronet Worldwide, Inc. (NASDAQ: EEFT) company, announced a collaboration to enhance cross-border payments, powered by the integration of Citi’s cross-border payments solution WorldLink® Payment Services and Dandelion’s expansive digital wallet network. headline: Citi sells 25% stake in Banamex for $2.3B
summary: The bank incurred a $726 million goodwill impairment charge from the transaction, which is set to close in the second half of 2026.
